instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0SW_LCD: What is PP3V3_S0SW_LCD? PP3V3_S0SW_LCD is a 3.3v power rail necessary to power the image circuitry on the screen. This is necessary to get a picture on the screen. .
definitions.PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT? PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the backlight on the LCD screen, this is necessary to get the screen to light up..
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image no chime
threads.message:
came in precleaned....

green light then orange.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.18volts (same as on working board from other MacBook)
Mouse lights up

<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 1.803v stable

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> 5.12v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> 3.332volt


missing
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> 0.000volt diode 0.532
<CHIP>U8300</CHIP>
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3.334 volt
<SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL>  0.000volt comes from <RESISTOR>R1431</RESISTOR> 84.9kohm (on board) comes from <CHIP>U0500</CHIP>
<SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL> 0.537diode on pin1 <CHIP>U8300</CHIP> 

<SIGNAL>PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> 0 volt

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image no chime
threads.message: Does it do a PRAM reset? Mouse light should go off and on again. Caps lock working on an external keyboard?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image no chime
threads.message:
no response on pram reset mouse light wil dimm a little bit but wont turn off, tested on 3 keyboard+cables
bios replacement with pram reset bios? to reset then replace right?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image no chime
threads.message: Mouse will probably not light if you unplug and put it back in. This board is just brain dead and thus it could be anything. The usual suspects <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, crap under SMC, clock chip.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image no chime
threads.message:
Mouse stil lights up even after 20 minutes after beeing on.

pulled in/out alot... and everytime works.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image no chime
threads.message: Is this some sort of mouse that always lights up? Try it on a known dead board that power on or a board without RAM, mouse should not light.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image no chime
threads.message: I got cought out with a mouse that did that. Had me stummped for ages.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image no chime
threads.message: on a know dead board it lights up for a few sec then turns off. also connected a external hdd/ssd caddy. same result on the 00165 keeps on, on the dead board turns off

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image no chime
threads.message: Any boot activity from a bootable USB HDD/USB stick?
